prohibitedTransport.title: Prohibited items for shipment
prohibitedTransport.description: Objects that, due to their nature or packaging, endanger postal services employees or the general public, or that may dirty or damage other postal objects, or the operator's equipment.
prohibitedTransport.lastText: AND OTHER ELEMENTS CONTEMPLATED IN THE LAW
prohibitedTransport.additionalDescription: The above prohibitions will be applied in accordance with current Colombian regulations and with those regulated by the Universal Postal Union and in accordance with the exceptions proposed therein.

privacy-policy.title: Personal Data Protection
content: GRUPO LOGÍSTICO ESPECIALIZADO S.A.S. wishes to inform: That in compliance with Statutory Law 1581 of 2012, which establishes the 'General Data Protection Regime' and the Regulatory Decree 1377 of 2013, it respectfully requests your authorization so that in a free, prior, clear, express, voluntary, and duly informed manner, you allow the company to collect, store, use, process, compile, exchange, treat, update, and dispose of the personal data and/or commercial information that have been provided and incorporated into our databases.

This information is and will be used in the development of the company’s role. Holders of personal data (employees, suppliers, service providers, clients, natural and/or legal persons, and contractors) expressly and unequivocally authorize GRUPO LOGÍSTICO ESPECIALIZADO S.A.S to maintain and manage all their information unless they indicate otherwise directly, expressly, unequivocally, and in writing within thirty (30) business days from the receipt of this communication, to the following email address:
contacto@glecolombia.com.

We remind you that you have the possibility to access, update, and delete your data at any time, and you also have the right to expressly request a correction, under the terms established by law, by sending a written communication to the email:
contacto@glecolombia.com or by calling 601 6953631.

terms-&-conditions.title: Terms & Conditions
content: G.L.E. COLOMBIA SAS is dedicated to providing innovative, personalized, timely and reliable logistics services.  To guarantee this development, an Integrated Management System (GIS) has been established and commitments have been defined that constitute a reference framework for defining the objectives.

The commitments established by the company listed below are aimed at meeting the needs, expectations and requirements of the interested parties involved in the supply chain and the integrated management system:
1. Comply with legal, regulatory and other requirements applicable to the company.

2. Implement control and risk management activities to maintain the integrity of the processes and prevent becoming involved in illicit activities, such as: smuggling, bribery, corruption, money laundering, financing of terrorism, among others.
3. Constantly review and evaluate the different components of the Integrated Management System (GIS) to guarantee its maintenance and continuous improvement.
4. Promote security in the use of information technology.
5. Strengthen the development of the skills and abilities of our human talent, ensuring their competence to fulfill their tasks, functions and responsibilities.
The aforementioned commitments will be mandatory for all interested parties involved, and will allow us to guarantee safe and reliable operations.

backlog-shipments.title: Backlog Shipments
content: Specialized Logistics Group, in compliance with resolution number 0001822 of July 4, 2018 of the Ministry of Information and Communications Technologies and Law 1369 of 2009, invites all citizens to consult the postal shipments declared in arrears and to recover the related pieces according to the attached list; as long as you are the sender or recipient user for those shipments that exhausted delivery attempts.
After three (3) months from the publication of the aforementioned notice on the operator's website, the backlog committee will meet and dispose of the unclaimed postal items.
In order to recover your shipment, you can contact the Bogotá customer service area at 601 6953631 or by email at compensaciones@glecolombia.com.co.
Resolution 1822 of July 4, 2018
Relation of shipments in arrears

pqrs.title: PQRS AND COMPENSATION
content: GRUPO LOGISTICO ESPECIALIZADO S.A.S has a customer service process available to its clients that has all the means required to comprehensively address their requests, complaints, claims, resources and requests for compensation.

To process a complaint or claim, the client must provide the following information: the guide number, the date of imposition, the status of user (sender or recipient), the identification document number, the address and telephone number and the description of the facts.
From the date of filing, GLE has 15 business days to provide the response, which will be sent to the address or email provided by the client.

When your request cannot be definitively addressed by our customer service, within 15 business days, this term may be extended when additional evidence is required, which will be communicated to you in writing, indicating the new date on which a response will be given.
If you wish to file a complaint or claim, you can do so through the contact form located
here.

services.title: Specialized services
description: Collection, transportation, distribution and door-to-door delivery service of packages and merchandise by packaging unit.
how-operate: We establish operational agreements that allow us to constitute the full and complete commitments between the parties.
Package and goods collection in our clients warehouses (for both parceling and according to specific type of transport vehicles).
Distribution and delivery of our client’s products throughout various destinations, both domestically and internationally.
Elaboration of guides and manifests according to logistical needs.
We have an aGILE integration system that allows our clients to trace their information online.
